p: J2H-1701 was tested for cross-genotype activities against seven genosubtypes (nine subtypes) of the virus using a dose–response assay in the HCVcc system. The representative dose–response plots for HCV inhibition and cytotoxicity are provided in Figure 2. J2H-1701 generally exhibited potent inhibition against the six HCV genotypes (HCV genotype 1a, 2a, 2 b, 3a, 4a, and 7a) whereas no significant cytotoxicity was observed for all tested genosubtypes. J2H-1701 showed IC 50 values in the nano-subnanomolar range in several HCV subgenotypes, which is much lower than those of a well-known HCV inhibitor, sofosbuvir ( Table 3). This demonstrates that J2H-1701 possesses effective multi-genotypic antiviral activity.
